radiographic_examinations.findings: Subacute right occipital infarct and bilateral basal ganglia calcification.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent CT imaging done 3 weeks later demonstrated interval development of new left temporoparietal and left occipital infarcts.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Intracranial stenoses affecting basilar artery, both posterior cerebral arteries, and to a lesser degree bilateral anterior cerebral arteries and middle cerebral arteries, suggestive of possible atherosclerosis.

radiographic_examinations.date: Prior to discharge, 6 weeks after initial presentation
radiographic_examinations.findings: Improvement in low attenuation of the bilateral occipito-parietal regions.
